title: Pumpkin Jambalaya
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare pumpkins by cutting off top quarter of each pumpkin, and removing seeds and fibers.
Place pumpkins on baking sheet with ½ of water in bottom of each pumpkin. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and place upside down on cooling rack to drain and cool. Set aside.
In large dutch oven heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onions, garlic, celery, and bell pepper. Cook for 5-10 minutes or until savory and aromatic.
Mix in tomatoes, stock, thyme, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper and paprika. Stir in rice,and bring to a rolling boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover and cook until rice is tender, about 30 minutes.
Add shrimp, Andouille sausage, and chicken.. Stir, and simmer 5 minutes more or until heated through.
Divide Jambalaya among pumpkin shells and sprinkle with parsley. Loosely cover with foil and return to oven. Bake 20 minutes more and cook 15 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 2 c. raw long grain white rice
½ lb Andouille sausage, coursley chopped
